questions.question: What do you make of Tyson on Joe Rogan saying that he was aroused by violence?
What do you think is more beautiful, brute force or effortless execution of a technique that dominates another human?
Is there some interesting principles and the process of changing that is useful to talk about?
Like the gravitational pull is what keeps you together and circling around one another, right?
What do you think makes a successful relationship if we can linger on that a little longer?
Are you more optimistic or pessimistic about the prospects of human civilization in maybe the 22nd century?
Like is it possible that your generation is the last generation to be alive on Earth?
Do you have a philosophy behind why you have or don't have kids on this topic?
What would you be doing if you weren't podcasting and posting the things you do on social media?
And of course people want to be successful, but do they want it enough to do the work?
For both you and I, do you have advice for me as a podcaster and for yourself as a podcast?
